website_summaries.verdict: Very popular, lightweight-yet-sturdy tablet stand with adjustable angle viewing and protective rubber supports.
pros: Stand is compatible with devices between 4 and 13 inches
Strengthened alloy steel for increased strength yet lighter weight
Rubber pads and feet to protect your tablet from scratches and bumps
Makes using your tablet easy and convenient – watch videos, read, type
cons: Some purchasers complained that the pad bounces a bit, depending on what they're doing on their device

website_summaries.verdict: A sleek and versatile iPad stand that is easy to adjust for horizontal or vertical viewing.
pros: Alloy steel construction delivers the perfect combination of style and function
Minimalist design makes the stand a terrific addition in a home or office space
Compatible with a wide range of iPads, as well as various tablets and e-readers
Silver finish completes the stand's modern look
cons: Upper rubber panels tend to slide down over time
Base is not wide enough, and an iPad needs to be perfectly centered to stay in place at all times

customer_reviews.title: Perfect holder for iPad Pro 9in
customer_reviews.text: Love this little stand, especially for use in the kitchen to follow recipes. Adjusts easily.
customer_reviews.author: Nikkole

customer_reviews.title: Great stand, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I just received the tablet stands from Lamicall. The one for tablets is great:   The other where the iPhone can be seen does not bend, so the angle is fixed. I find this stand to be sturdy and very well built, and in the images I am using the IPP 10.5 and Kindle Paperwhite, and for TStand the IPP 9.7.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Santos

customer_reviews.title: I love this stand!
customer_reviews.text: This stand is the best I have found - it is adjustable in multiple ways and it holds my iPad Pro in or out of a case - open or shut. I purchased a bluetooth keyboard that actually fits in my case - the stand holds it all! I no longer have to place the iPad down on a table or counter to charge it - it is safe in the holder even for charging. Works everywhere - kitchen, office, dresser top. Will hold multiple sizes of tablets, adjusts for viewing easily and securely. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: DebAnna

customer_reviews.title: No more neck strain.
customer_reviews.text: I can adjust this little stand up and down as I move, easily throw it in my bag to use anywhere, and it even has a cut out for charging while in portrait mode. That's a feature many stand companies don't think about but it makes a huge difference in user friendliness. The adjustable hinge is sturdy and I have no worries about it becoming loose and drooping down over time. Tiny rubber feet ensure your stand stays where you put it. Thanks to the stands small footprint I can put it on my garden tub ledge and watch tv while I soak.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, mostly
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few tablet/phone stands, but this is the best one. It's well-designed and sturdy, and best of all, for me, is that it has a wide lip that the tablet rests on. So it accommodates my Samsung S2 with its case attached. The only downside so far is that when I angle the tablet in a more vertical position, the stand tends to move backwards when I press on it. I've tried cleaning the small rubber feet, which helps somewhat, but then they just accumulate dust after a while and start slipping again. So I've had to keep the tablet angled more horizontally. Other than that, I'm happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Fits with 12.9” iPad Pro & rubber surround case
customer_reviews.text: I had my iPad Pro 12.9” first generation in an OtterBox Defender Series Case with the rubber surround and snap-on hardshell that includes a kickstand for propping up the iPad. When the kickstand broke I threw away the hard shell part, and I was concerned that the curved crook wouldn’t accommodate the iPad’s width including the rubber surround. Fits perfectly, also fits my iPhone 7+ with chunky case perfectly. The iPad is a beast weight-wise but this holder doesn’t move under its weight. Cannot beat this for $15.
customer_reviews.author: DDM11

customer_reviews.title: A high quality stand for your Amazon Fire HD10 that looks like it belongs on your office desk.
customer_reviews.text: I am very, very happy using this stand with my Amazon Fire HD10 tablet. The build quality is professional and doesn't look like a cheap stand. The anti-skip mats work well with a very low chance of the tablet slipping out. The adjustable hinge is easy to adjust with force, though I wonder if it will wear out over time. But for now, the stand keeps the tablet in place, even as I tap on the tablet. I paid full price for this product and still wrote a rave review, though I wouldn't mind getting another one of these for a discount....*wink*
customer_reviews.author: Dwinn

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for iPad 12.9” or big tablets
customer_reviews.text: The product is well built but it is not stable enough for an iPad Pro 12.9” or any larger tablet. If you are just using the iPad as a monitor and not touching it it might work for you. But as soon as you move it a little bit or try to use your Apple Pencil it will not be stable enough and the weight will make it fall backwards.
customer_reviews.author: rromo

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product, Sturdy, Steady, Practical
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent tablet stand. It’s sturdy, unobtrusive, and stylish. It’s metal not plastic for starters. I am using it with a naked iPad Pro 10.5”. This stand puts my iPad at a perfect height for viewing as I type and surf. I got the black model of the stand and it’s barely noticeable on my desk since I have a space gray iPad. My setup is the iPad Pro on my stand with an Apple Smart Keyboard and a Magic Mouse. I’ve been able to put my 15” MacBook away and replace it with this setup for most of my needs and I have more space available on my desk top. I unreservedly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: BernieS

customer_reviews.title: Too small for the Ipad pro 12.9
customer_reviews.text: At certain angles it fails to balance properly causing the ipad to fall out of its cradle. Definitely not recommended for the larger ipads.
customer_reviews.author: Bryannah Katayama

customer_reviews.title: Micro-wobbles
customer_reviews.text: This is nice and I love having it for my kitchen iPad, but it micro-wobbles like crazy whenever I touch the iPad. It's subtle, but when I'm trying to read a recipe and gently tap the screen, it ends up being pretty distracting.
customer_reviews.author: Evan W.

customer_reviews.title: Best product for viewing movies and tv series on your mobile device ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is a surprisingly durable and yet flexible device. I use it for watching YouTube videos and for listening to audiobooks on my phone. In addition, it is sturdy enough to use my Kindle Fire device while watching videos and movies on Hulu plus and on the Funimation app. It also has just the right kind of gap at the bottom, which will allow you to charge your device while using it. It even holds up well, when you want to transport it in your purse or backpack. I would highly recommend it. I have not tried to use an iPad on it yet, but I am hoping that, that will work quite well too.
customer_reviews.author: Katiepuppygirl

customer_reviews.title: Simple and well made!
customer_reviews.text: If you need something to raise your tablet up off the table get this! The tilt works very well it's firm and doesn't move with tapping you have to force it to move to change the angles. It is all metal with rubber feet on the bottom and where the tablet seats and the metal is thick enough that it doesn't allow the tablet to bounce. As far as height goes it isn't that high but has enough clesrsnce to let the tablet be plugged in at the bottom as long as it is tilted back which most of the time you do or have it in landscape. Just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: NitriQ

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: For the first time in 8 years I can put my old IPad 2 to good use. My iPad 2 with its thick cover fits perfectly on the stand. The stand is quite sturdy as long as it is on a completely flat surface. The Ipad 2 does shake during use because the entire back isn’t supported. But this is not a deal breaker for me. I can now use my iPad 2 to watch my home surveillance system and play backgammon without constantly picking it up. I will be purchasing another for my Kindle. This stand is convenient.
customer_reviews.author: mshumph

customer_reviews.title: ... stand is just what I ordered and I am happy with how it works
customer_reviews.text: The stand is just what I ordered and I am happy with how it works. I've used my iphone on it, my surface pro 4 and my Nintendo Switch. It barely fits with the Nintendo Switch, but it fits and works. If you need something that collapses and is compact for travel, this is not the stand for you. If you want something that will stay at home or on your desk, then I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: burnsb

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect. Just One LITTLE Problem
customer_reviews.text: I did lots of research and since I already own and love Lamicall iPhone stands, I got this for my iPad. It's sturdy, attractive, holds my iPad with a thick case... everything about this is 5 stars except whoever slapped on the gray sticker pads. So if my iPad isn't on the stand, the stand itself looks sloppy. I'm not sending it back, but I'm disappointed that the manufacturer is sooooooooo close to perfect, but then they carelessly slap on the gray bumper pads and make it look cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Larry B

customer_reviews.title: Bought Two!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the one for a tablet with the hopes that it also works for a phone. It does! This is sturdy and very well constructed. The hinges are tight, so they stay in place after adjustment. The only thing I wish was better was that it folded flat so it fits well in my bag. I ended buying 2, one for work and one for home. I bought the black and the rose gold (which is pink). #protip: The stand comes with a small envelope of replacement pads. I taped the envelope on the underside of the moveable tray that the device rests one because I know darn well, I am not keeping track of that.
customer_reviews.author: J. Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great Stand
customer_reviews.text: Now that I'm using my new tablet to Zoom and Skye a lot during this virus pandemic, I thought this would be a useful tool. It is indeed! It is very well made....substantial, sturdy, stable. It is made of metal, nicely coated, relatively weighted. The rubber pads on it protect your tablet from rubbing on metal. And the hinge for rotating the viewing angle is excellent....easy to move but tight enough to stay where you put it. It even comes with extra pads should the ones attached need to be replace (which I doubt will be needed.) I am very happy with this stand.
customer_reviews.author: TJ in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Topples over a bit, but decent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this stand for my Surface Pro so I could put it on my desk at work in tablet mode to markup PDFs (got tired of holding it in my lap at an angle). I have my Surface in a case and don't want to take it out of the case every time I want to use the stand, so I just place it on the stand and leave the top part of the case dangling off the side. While it's definitely not a heavy case, the weight makes the stand topple over if it's not bent forward far enough. Would give it 5 stars if the base was weighted. But it works great otherwise; simple!
customer_reviews.author: Stellar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to use with our iPad, iPad mini and it works even with our iPhones. All have cases. Used primarily on the kitchen table and love the fact I can move it to the counter and adjust the tilt when cooking for recipes, etc. Very stable, no problem with tipping or devices sliding. There are several similar looking models though so I caution to really look at the dimensions thumbnail to get the one that fits your device best (like the depth and width of where your device will sit and the length of the bottom support for stability). I’m very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PJB

customer_reviews.title: Small Sturdy and Strong = Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This for me is very well made. I like the stiffness of the rest or the cradle that my Asus portable monitor sits on holds it quite well as well as my tablets it's small but that doesn't take away from the fact that it does the job. I have purchase other base stands that looked good but just couldn't get past the flimsy cradles or support arms that just couldn't hold the tablets in one spot always having the frustration of readjusting it time after time when they were brand new. I still have a couple around that I paid a good bit for that maybe if they made phones big enough it would hold one in place.🤓
customer_reviews.author: BobbyZ

customer_reviews.title: The Stand is Big & Sturdy - holds the smallest iPhone to large portrait tablets. LOVE IT !
customer_reviews.text: LAMICALL - Adjustable Tablet Stand The stand is very sturdy, made of metal, comes in a nice box & has extra grey cushions (2 cirles for under the stand, 1 rectangle for the top edge, 1 large for the curved shelf) see the photo. And the stand is big - the photo is of an iPhone 5, the next is an iPhone 6 Plus & the last is an 11 inch tablet in portrait position. It's very stable while tapping on the big tablet - the base plate pads keep the stand in one place. It also holds tablets that are fastened to thick bulky covers. Absolutely Love It !
customer_reviews.author: Dav

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love this. There are tons of viewing angles, and I especially like that it elevates my tablet or phone off the table surface, so if I spill something, I’m not at risk of harming my devices. The only issue I have is that if you tilt the stand too far forward, the iPad inevitably falls and makes a loud crashing noise, presumably damaging it over time. Of course, this is very obvious, but it is a little easier to accidentally tip this over than one would think. Other than simple user errors such as the one I just listed, this is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Ended up purchasing two - one for home and the other for work!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Very sturdy; doesn't wobble or lose its "angle" (good tension) on its own. Holds my iPad Pro perfectly (I have other stands that work for smaller tablets/phone but the iPad pro is just too heavy for those and they fall over or wobble if you try to write on it while on a stand.) My only frustration (which would compromise the functionality) is that it's a bit bulky to move from one place to another. Which is why I purchased a second one to stay at work and the other at home.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia Pond

customer_reviews.title: I can barely imagine using my iPad without it
customer_reviews.text: Tablets are great, but they're often hard to keep hold of. All sorts of cases that sort of fold up and hold them in place for viewing exist, but most are not particularly stable. This thing is like a monitor mount: it holds your tablet in place, the viewing angle is easy to adjust, and 95% of the time my iPad is resting in it. I've watched videos, played mobile games, even typed up documents using this mount. The rubber pads keep it from scratching your tablet, even without a case, and the rubber feet keep it from scratching your coffee table.
customer_reviews.author: J. Milligan

customer_reviews.title: Great stand....
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the sturdiness of this stand, but anything over a 10" tablet might be slightly unsteady. With that said, I use it as a portable stand, so I move it multiple times a day. If you were to leave it set in one place, a large tablet might be steady as well. With that said, this is THE BEST stand I have purchased in ages. Most stands will not hold a tablet because they are not heavy enough or the base is too small. I also appreciate that it sits up a little higher than most stands. It is just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Rawcliffe

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, large enough to accommodate my tablet (7" Kindle) ...
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, large enough to accommodate my tablet (7" Kindle) or phone (Samsung Note 8). Shipment was fast. The device also comes with additional anti-skid pads if you need more than the ones already on the stand. However, there are multiple pads already in place and they seem to be sufficient for me. I recommend this stand.
customer_reviews.author: Bmrscreamr

customer_reviews.title: Really nice iPad accessory
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice and versatile iPad accessory. It looks great on your desktop. You can leave your iPad in its Apple clamshell case, detach the magnetic keyboard, and use it with an outboard keyboard and even a mouse, much like a desktop. Then for travel it removes from this stand, I clamp the portable magnetic keyboard onto it, and I'm ready to go. So for me this functions essentially as a docking station and it works great for this, with class and panache. I have bought these for all the iPad users in our office and we are all very pleased. RJB.
customer_reviews.author: Roger J. BuffingtonTop Contributor: Fantasy Books

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy little stand but watch out for it's slightly sharp edges.
customer_reviews.text: Pros 1. After having the ability to fully control which way my ipad is tilted even by the slightest difference in angles, I can't back to any other one size fits all ipad stands/cases. 2.Built like a little tank. 3. Lighter than it looks but still very sturdy with very little movement. Cons 1. It seems it was cut to do design with nothing else really being done. The edges are sharp and it would have been better if they had been filed down so there were no sharp edges that can cut and potentially damage surfaces. I made the mistake of sitting my magic keyboard on it's base and it scratched the plastic on the back of my keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Spyder

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, substantial stand.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and well packed. Very sturdy and substantial, feels like heavy aluminum. Easy to adjust the position to hold my iPad Pro 9.7. I am currently using it in landscape mode, but it does feel stable in portrait mode also. It stays where it is until you readjust. The rubbery pads on the stand hold the iPad securely. I currently have the iPad in a Poetic Revolution hard case (which makes it about 3/4" thick) and it fits in the stand well. There are also 4 small rubbery pads on the base of the stand so it does not slide around. I am very pleased with this stand and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I wish the lip that holds the tablet was deeper since I leave my tablet in the cover. UPDATED: Lamicall contacted me regarding my original review where I wished the lip that holds the tablet was deeper so I can leave the cover on the tablet. They not only updated their product but they also refunded my purchase price since I was not completely satisfied (3 stars). I am updating to 5 stars based upon their customer service and the fact that they listened to my review. Here is the link to the updated product:
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Dogs

customer_reviews.title: Very small
customer_reviews.text: The main photo for this product is intentionally deceiving. It shows an iPad Pro fitting perfectly into it with the edges lining up, making it seem like the product is considerably larger than it actually is, as if it’s the size of a regular iMac base. The product is well constructed but it is incredibly small about the size that would be good for a regular iPhone, not a 13 inch tablet. It’s kind of sad because if the product was a little bit larger it would be perfect, but it just doesn’t seem too stable with the full size12.9 inch iPad Pro.
customer_reviews.author: StaticCherry

customer_reviews.title: Tablet Stand 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: The iPad Tablet Stand is wonderful and works great. Sturdy. The delivery from Amazon and UPS was terrible. 2 weeks late. Prime delivery made lots of promises but that turned out to be false. 21 trailers from Amazon sat at the local UPS depot that had no priority for delivery. Prime membership is becoming less valuable each year.
customer_reviews.author: BaRP

customer_reviews.title: Great for Zoom
customer_reviews.text: This stand for my iPad is great for Zoom calls. I ordered a second one so I don't have to keep moving one around the house. It is sturdy and adjusts to multiple angles. I have a 10.2 size iPad in a wrap around case with a cover. For my Zoom exercise class, I remove the cover so I can use the back camera and it also fits, because of the rubber cushions added into the holder. They keep my iPad from moving around. The rubber feet on the bottom keep it from scratching my table. This has been an essential stand to have, since I am on Zoom calls a lot.
customer_reviews.author: C.Mac

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Jackpot! This thing is awesome. This is my second attempt at finding one for my iPad, YouTube, TicTok obsessed daughter. Her iPad goes everywhere and she is constantly propping it up against something. My first purchase was ok, but she stopped using it pretty quickly because it was a bit flimsy. This one is perfect, sturdy and looks great. It is also versatile. I kinda want one myself. It works well even with my iPhone X Plus, but clearly not something I would really need- but it does fit!
customer_reviews.author: amazonjunkie

customer_reviews.title: COVID essential!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this caddy for a one time use to display an iPad at a conference. Well... I have been using this EVERY DAY since working from home: I use on my work desk to hold my phone while I am working, I use it to hold my phone while I have zoom calls for work or with friends, and I use it to hold my phone when viewing web content with my family. It is super sturdy, and very versatile. Works well with both my classic iPad and iPhone 8. I'll be buying a few more if/when we return to work so I can have one at each of my workstation.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fortier

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this stand, it is what I was looking for. I can easily put my ipad (12inch) on my desk and having it as a secondary display. Also when I take it to the kitchen I can watch youtube/recipes and the support is amazing. Even great for face chat, the position is also adjustable so you can have the tablet in almost any position you want. Vertical or horizontal this support is great! It has some grips on the bottom for you to not worry about sliping it, even has some spare parts available.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to switch from portrait to landscape to tablet.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my (company issued) work iPad. It fits perfect below my other computer screens, is easy to move when needed and I can adjust the angle in portrait or landscape mode. I took off 1 star (unable to give 4.5 stars) because the base is a fixed L-shape and makes portability awkward, since it is a work iPad and I have to take it home every night (shared workspace), or walk to the other side of the building from where my desk is and where I park to get to my locker.
customer_reviews.author: S. Geinert

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: I have an iPhone stand similar to the Kindle stand that I received. I like the quality of the product and think it will last a long time. I wasn't looking for anything fancy, just simple and of good construction, which is what I received. I am very pleased with the product and look forward to using it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Donna McBroom-Theriot

customer_reviews.title: Safe your money
customer_reviews.text: It will not hold your device if it has any kind of case on it.
customer_reviews.author: cynlis

customer_reviews.title: Must have item!
customer_reviews.text: This stand works great! I moved to a new home where I cannot get antenna tv, so I have been watching morning tv on my Ipad. I have a cover/stand that didn't allow for a good viewing angle, and touching the iPad to raise the volume, change channels, mute, etc., caused the cover to fall over! Well, I opened the package with this great little stand inside, put the iPad on the stand, and voila'! Perfect viewing angle, and the ability to use all functions without the iPad falling over!
customer_reviews.author: James F. Mcerlean Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect stand for my iPad, especially now that I'm using it for Zoom meetings. It feels very stable with the iPad in the horizontal and vertical positions. It's fairly easy to adjust the angle - any easier and it would move too easily. The rubber parts keep the iPad from slipping without scratching it. It actually looks very attractive and came in a shaped box which kept it safe during transit. I had to buy a second one for my husband, he liked it so much!
customer_reviews.author: Lise P.

customer_reviews.title: Charming and sturdy design
customer_reviews.text: I love this stand. Bought it for my son and then he did t need it so I tried it for my iPad and phone. It is so much better than using a folding jacket in the iPad or nothing for the phone. It is really pretty and well made and sturdy. Good for reading anything on iPad or phone especially recipes or whatever you are reading when either standing or sitting and the metal and design is like a tiny desktop iMac stand, with the hole on the back for the cord. So cute!
customer_reviews.author: Oaklandish Otter

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Bought for myself and as a birthday gift for a co worker and it’s perfect for iPad and iphone. Love that you can adjust it, so convenient. I love the color I got rose gold, looks super cute next to my other rose gold Apple products tbh :) & I got a silver for my friend :-) will repurchase for future occasions
customer_reviews.author: Miss_gizzy

customer_reviews.title: In the age of Zoom meetings, you need this!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased another brand of stand, that was rickety and came apart. I was afraid to use it, fearing damage to my phone or iPad. This one is wonderful!! It’s sturdy, but not heavy, doesn’t take up a lot of room, but does a great job. Comfortably holds my iPad in its otter case. I’ve since bought two for family members, everyone that sees it wants one, and they love it too. My father could not believe how easy this made using his iPad for him. Honestly, one of the best purchases I’ve ever made.
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: Great stand
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these for my ASUS ASUS ZenScreen MB16AC 15.6" monitor, even though it's meant for tablets. The design of the display fits rather nicely with this stand despite the size. It just arrived today, and I love it already. It's clearly well built, stable, versatile, and just simply well designed, and the price is right. I will probably add a bit of velcro to keep the display stable even when it is tilted forward, but it isn't necessary for most viewing angles.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to remote learning workspace
customer_reviews.text: The tablet case that propped up our “outdated” iPad Pro wasn’t cutting it for remote learning. This stand is perfect for our purposes. It lifts the iPad off the desk leaving more writing space. The tilt can be adjusted to a reasonable angle so the Zoom classroom can see faces instead of ceiling and tops of heads. The desk has been bumped by children and the stand holds steady. It CAN hold the big iPad Pro but I wouldn’t go much bigger than that.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette M

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a "high tech" item so don't expect to be ultra-ecstatic over it. However, you will find that you won't be the least bit disappointed either. It is exactly as advertised. My biggest "pro" is that it is extremely durable and lightweight. This doesn't feel anything like a discount product/solution. My only "con" is that it came with some "pads" of some sort that I have absolutely no idea what they are for (no instructions). However, I just put my iPad in the stand and it is secure and accessible. It is absolutely not going anywhere. This is a beautiful stand that I would highly recommend as a solution for anyone in the market for one!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Davis

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Thing in a Long Time...
customer_reviews.text: This tablet stand is super - in every way, for all purposes, in design, function, and quality. Solid and stable, able to hold phones and tablets in all orientations, clean beautiful aluminum with rubbery bottom and cradle, it exceeded our expectations in every way possible. No kidding, there is zero negatives with this product. If you want something to hold your tablet or phone for FaceTime, Zoom, etc., or just browsing, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: 80s Product

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stand-I got it for my 2020 iPad Pro 12.9 and it works well in portrait or landscape. It’s sturdy and doesn’t slide. I really like that it has two rubber grey tabs on top and two in the cradle on bottom because it cushions your device-great product!
customer_reviews.author: krissy

customer_reviews.title: Well made metal stand for the iPad
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy metal stand. It elevates the iPad off the table and lets you adjust for a comfortable angle to use and view your tablet. The tablet stays put very well, the stand does not move or swivel on you when touching the screen. It's been through several months of daily use and we love it. Still sturdy, still tight enough to not move on its own when being used and still easy enough to readjust. If you are looking for a great tabletop or desktop stand for your tablet. This is a no brainer - buy it.
customer_reviews.author: FredK

customer_reviews.title: Love this tablet/phone stand!  Best out there!
customer_reviews.text: This is very well designed! No sharp edges, matches the iMac very closely, so a complement on a desk if you own one. Seems to be very high quality. I liked it so much, I returned to buy a 2nd one. Holds large 10 inch tablets very well, and hold phones very well. also holds iPads. It has little rubber cushion stickies on it, to support and to keep from scratching devices. Keeps them from sliding off too. Very nice, I am very happy with this purchase. Worth the price! Some are cheaper, this is better!
customer_reviews.author: Will Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great solution
customer_reviews.text: This stand for my tablet is a wonderful addition. We are getting word from the medical profession that many appointments will now be done on-line due to the COVID-19 situation. Best situation is to have your device about eye level with the provider on your screen. When sitting a table I need about six books stacked up to get the best eye level height. This stand is fully adjustable and is very well built. If you need a stand: buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: R. Walton

customer_reviews.title: Good for holding my Ipad

It can get wobbly if it’s not on a hard surface, but it’s not a big deal to me. I mainly use it to prop up my IPad on the floor when I’m doing yoga. It’s also handy to use while charging my phone so I can have the phone propped up Rather than having it lay flat on my desk. I’m glad I bought this, it’s very useful.
customer_reviews.author: A. Blesi

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!

customer_reviews.title: Tablet Stand For Point Of Sale
customer_reviews.text: I needed this stand for when I used my tablet as a point of sale when I do events. It is adjustable for customers to sign their name, email or phone number without it falling down. Customers can use their finger to enter in information and it does not fall over or wobble. It has sticky rubber feet on the bottom as well as the cradle for the table to sit in without is sliding around. Fit and finish is good quality and adds a professional touch to my set up. If this one goes bad, I will purchase another one because it is a perfect size for a 10-inch tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Deonce Evans

customer_reviews.title: Best versatile iPad stand yet!
customer_reviews.text: Normally, I would definitely give this stand a five star, because it’s by far the best iPad stand I’ve bought, and I have bought many. The thing that makes me the happiest is the fact you can go from landscape view to portrait view without having to unplug it. I keep mine plugged in all the time and it’s annoying to have to unplug it. I wish programs would make all apps available with both views. Anyway, getting back to my four star rating, the stand can be a bit top heavy. If the base was just a little wider, it would be perfect. Still love it, however.

customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous gadget

customer_reviews.author: Chris V.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!

I am very pleased with this purchase and would/will recommend to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: mz johansen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stand for my iPad Pro 12.9"
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stand, that looks sweet. It will fit well on your desk if you want to match other iDevices that you own. It has that feeling of outstanding Apple-like quality. Otherwise, this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael the Skeptic

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: I love this pretty stand for my iPad. I watch tutorials for card making and can sit it right in front of my workspace for easy viewing. Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Sherer

customer_reviews.title: What a Quality Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy metal stand that was well-designed. I'm using it with a tablet that is 10.5 inches x 6.75 inches (the tablet part of an ASUS T100). Even in portrait mode, this holds the tablet well. The grippy pads on the bottom and on the holder part make sure everything stays in place. I use this setup along with a bluetooth keyboard. I can adjust the position so that I can read the screen through the bottom of my bifocals. I also use it at home, with the tablet acting as a second monitor. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality stand. I have a iPad Pro. The stand holds it nicely in the landscape configuration but in the portrait configuration it isn’t completely sturdy. I have to be careful how I touch the screen near the top or it topples over. Also in the portrait mode the connector on the bottom is squeezed unless I have tilted the stand back farther than I like. This also makes it more prone to tip over. I can live with it but, as I say, I’m disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: fdavidn

customer_reviews.title: How well does this work
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item, just what I was looking for to watch a video on the iPad, while trying to concentrate on some other thing. I wanted it to be easy to store and sturdy enough to hold my iPad and it does both. This way I can be using my computer for other things and watching something on the iPad, or when not convenient to drag the computer out, I now have a great way to prop it up and not have it fall on something else.
customer_reviews.author: Kay SD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Kindergarten iPad Use
customer_reviews.text: The Lamicall Tablet Stand is the perfect solution for our kindergartener’s use of an iPad for distance learning. It holds the iPad securely and we can adjust the angle so that she is on camera. When we tried to just use the iPad with a basic case it pointed up at her forehead and when she tried to type on it or use her finger as the cursor, it would oftentimes fall over. We couldn’t be happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joani Share

customer_reviews.title: Small but Mighty
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome. I bought it for my husbands Ipad Pro which so he could have zoom sessions with his speech clinicians during the pandemic. This works great, fit right in with my iPad Pro and it never slid and it stayed secure. Now granted I have only used it one day but will update if anything goes wrong. The quality is made very well.
customer_reviews.author: smcph

customer_reviews.title: For the Echo Show
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed with what was available as an adjustable stand for my Echo Show. I purchased one of these for my iPad and found it would be near perfect for that purpose. I've been sending them to my daughters so they can adjust their Shows to allow me and my wife to see my grandchildren and them us. Simple solid design that provides basic the flexibility we needed. The only drawback is the Show movement when attempting to use the buttons or touchscreen - like an animal just far enough out on a branch to sway slightly. Not being specifically designed for my purpose, I give it five stars all round.
customer_reviews.author: Percy Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Great stand!
customer_reviews.text: It's a great stand for my 12.9 inch iPad Pro. The rubber feet keep it sturdy on a table and the little rubber pads on the stand prevent it from scratching my iPad. Really sturdy, it bends to pretty much whatever angle you want it to. It also comes with replacement pieces in case the rubber parts fall off, which is a nice little addition. It also works as a pretty good iPhone stand, and if you're brave enough, it'll also work with a 13 inch MacBook. The only complaint I have is that I wish it folded flat, you can't really carry it anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: STURDY, adjustable viewing angle. Landscape or portrait mode placement. Handles thick cases.
customer_reviews.text: Oh what a sweet stand! Even though it's remarkably compact, it's stable as a rock with the tablet sitting on it in portrait, (vertical), mode. It drops in landscape mode just fine too! It's easy to pick up and then set right back in. My 10.1" Galaxy Tab A has a beefy case surronding it, and the tablet just drops right in place no problem. My tablet is also heavy and when the viewing angle is adjusted, it holds perfect! This is one sturdy well built stand, I highly recommend this! I've been looking for a great stand for my tablet and I have found it!

Your head is in a more upright position, better even than the iPad cover/stand in the upright position. Probably a lot better for us, too, not being so bent over reading. Well worth it.
